main_definition: Reforms refer to changes or improvements made in policies, systems, structures, or institutions with the aim of achieving better outcomes.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Political and social changes initiated by authorities
meanings_and_examples.example: The government's reforms to education focused on improving school infrastructure and curriculum.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Changes made in a law, rule, or policy to make it better
meanings_and_examples.example: Reforming the criminal justice system by reducing mandatory minimum sentences for non-violent offenses.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Amendments aimed at correcting flaws or shortcomings in existing practices
meanings_and_examples.example: Healthcare reforms to provide universal coverage and improve the quality of care.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Modernization efforts targeting outdated methods or technologies
meanings_and_examples.example: Industrial sector reforms introducing new manufacturing techniques for increased efficiency.
